Situation1: An irate long-time customer challenges the legitimacy of the offer and demands thorough explanations.
Expectation2: Show love and kindness to others, following the teachings of Jesus
Situation2: They notice someone in their circle going through difficulties and respond with care
Story:
The phone pressed against my ear, I listened as Mr. Harris, a long-time customer, unleashed his frustration. “How can you call this a real offer? I’ve been loyal for years, and now you’re trying to trick me?” His voice trembled with anger and disappointment. As a telemarketer, I was trained to handle objections, to keep my tone steady, to defend the legitimacy of our promotions. My supervisor’s words echoed in my mind: “Don’t let them rattle you. Stick to the script. Close the deal.”

But as a Christian, I felt a different pull. I remembered the teachings of Jesus—show love, be patient, offer understanding. I knew Mr. Harris had recently lost his wife; I’d seen the note in his file. My heart ached to respond with compassion, to set aside the sales pitch and simply listen, to offer a kind word instead of a rebuttal.

Caught between the demands of my job and the call to kindness, I felt my chest tighten. My mind raced, torn between the script in front of me and the quiet voice urging me to care for a hurting soul.
